test_description: This test covers topics related to the Transport and Session layers, including TCP, UDP, flow control, error control, congestion control, and session layer protocols.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Transport layer?
questions.options_b: To provide reliable end-to-end communication between processes

questions.question: Which Transport layer protocol is connection-oriented?
What is the main advantage of UDP over TCP?
Which field in a TCP header is used for flow control?
What is the purpose of the three-way handshake in TCP?
Which of the following is NOT a feature of TCP?
What is the purpose of the Session layer?
questions.options_a: To establish, manage, and terminate sessions between applications

questions.question: Which protocol is an example of a Session layer protocol?
What is the purpose of TCP's sliding window protocol?
questions.options_b: To provide flow control and reliable delivery

questions.question: Which of the following applications would most likely use UDP?
What is the purpose of TCP timers?
questions.options_b: To handle various aspects of connection management and reliability
questions.options_d: To limit the time an application can use the network

questions.question: Which TCP congestion control algorithm gradually increases the window size?
What is the purpose of the SYN flag in a TCP segment?
questions.options_a: To synchronize sequence numbers during connection establishment

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of UDP?
What is the purpose of the RPC (Remote Procedure Call) protocol?
questions.options_a: To allow a program to execute procedures on another computer

questions.question: Which TCP timer ensures that a connection is not kept open indefinitely?
What is the purpose of TCP's fast retransmit mechanism?
questions.options_b: To retransmit lost segments without waiting for a timeout

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a TCP timer?
What is the purpose of the Session layer's dialog control?
questions.options_a: To determine which device can transmit at a given time
questions.options_b: To establish, manage, and terminate sessions between applications

questions.question: Which of the following best describes TCP's error control mechanism?
questions.options_a: Uses checksums and acknowledgments to detect and recover from errors
questions.options_c: Detects errors but doesn't recover from them
questions.options_d: Uses only parity checks for error detection
